results.title: Winter sleepers = Winterschlafer
results.creator_credit: Tom Tykwer, Stefan Arndt, German Independents, FFA - Filmforderungsanstalt, Bavaria Film, BMI, Arte, Mitteldeutscher Rundfunk, WDR, Palladio Film, FilmFernsehFonds Bayern, Filmstiftung NRW and X filme creative Pool
results.brief_description: Tykwer’s elaborately designed second feature, which preceded his commercially successful ‘Run Lola Run’ (1998), is set in a ski village in a remote province in southern Germany. The plot follows the various threads that connect the confused lives of two couples in their thirties. Theo, a projectionist in the local theatre, steals a car belonging to lovers Rebecca and Marco and takes it for a joyride. He collides with the car of a local farmer gravely injuring his daughter, but due to a short term memory loss, leaves the scene without helping the injured girl or her family. Later he becomes involved with Laura, a nurse, who has been taking care of the girl. Both couples are rootless and without ambition or drive, and Tywker uses the time allowed by his elliptical narrative to compare and contrast the two relationships on display. He deploys stylistic formalism to make connections between what are essentially shallow characters. Their incompatibilities are underpinned by the use of colour-coding, while the repeated use of lap dissolves sets up unexpected connections between them. Cast includes Floriane Daniel, Heino Ferch, Ulrich Matthes, Marie-Lou Sellem and Josef Bierbichler. In German with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Tykwer, Stefan Arndt, German Independents, FFA - Filmforderungsanstalt, Bavaria Film, BMI, Arte, Mitteldeutscher Rundfunk, WDR, Palladio Film, FilmFernsehFonds Bayern, Filmstiftung NRW and X filme creative Pool

results.title: In time of pestilence. The Pythoness
results.creator_credit: Michael Warne, Joan Maude, John Halas, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and British Film Institute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Painter and poet: an experiment in words, music and paintings”.
The third part of a series devised by Joan Maude and Michael Warre incorporating the works of writers, painters and musicians to create an experimental animated film. This part consists of two short films. ‘In time of pestilence’ by Thomas Nashe, narrated by Robert Harris, drawings by Michael Ayrton (3:18 mins). ‘The Pythoness’ by Kathleen Raine, narrated by Mary Morris, drawings by Henry Moore (2:00 mins). Photography by W. Traylor and R. Turk, music by Matyas Seiber, edited by Jack King.

results.title: Twa corbies. Spring and winter
results.creator_credit: Michael Warre, Joan Maude, John Halas, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and British Film Institute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Painter and poet: an experiment in words, music and paintings”.
The first part of a series devised by John Maude and Michael Warre incorporating the works of writers, painters and musicians to create an experimental animated film. This part consists of two short films. ‘Twa corbies’ by anonymous narrated by John Laurie, drawings by Michael Rothenstien (2:24 mins). ‘Spring and winter’ by William Shakespeare, music by Dr. Arne and sung by Peter Pears, drawings by Mervyn Peake (5:40 mins). Photography by W. Traylor and R. Turk, music by Matyas Seiber, edited by Jack King.

results.title: Winter light = Nattvardsgarterna
results.brief_description: The second film in his trilogy on faith, “Winter light” springs from Bergman’s desire to define Man’s relation to God - if He exists. A village pastor, unloved and empty of faith, reveals his bitter failure to offer spiritual consolation to his flock. Sombre and poignant, the film sketches a world of half-empty churches - but a world not entirely without hope in God’s universe. The story brings together four personalities in a shared quest for siritual reassurance. A susceptible and disillusioned fisherman (Max von Sydow) is urged by his wife (Gunnel Lindboim) to seek solace from his local priest (Gunnar Bjornstrand). However the priest is struggling to regain his own belief - a tragic and intimately depicted conflict, in which he is eventually supported by the cynical resilience of the local schoolmistress (Ingrid Thulin). Swedish language with English subtitles.

results.title: Painter and poet: an experiment in words, music and paintings
results.creator_credit: Michael Warre, Joan Maude, John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: A four part series, containing a total of 8 short films for which contempory British painters were commissioned to script in picture, a poem. Each film is accompanied by music and narrated by English performers. The films were produced by John Halas in association with Joan Maude and Michael Warre who devised the script in co-operation with the painters.

results.title: Wintergarden
results.creator_credit: Lower Manhattan Cultural Council, Gregg Featherman and Mary Lucier
results.material_description: two-channel, six-monitor installation, video, colour and audio
results.brief_description: This two-channel, six-monitor installation, merges lucid imagery with sculptural form, in an exploration of pastoral and urban landscapes, nature and culture. Originally produced for New York’s Chase Manhattan Plaza, this work contrasts serene natural images from a highly cultivated Japanese garden with the hard-edged architectural landscape of Manhattan. Lucier finds formal parallels to the sensual flowers and calm pools in the cool, silvery reflections of the steel and glass skyscrapers. The dichotomy between natural and urban landscape is mirrored in Earl Howard’s haunting score, which shifts from the ringing of wind chimes to the magnified ambient sounds of the city street.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lower Manhattan Cultural Council, Gregg Featherman and Mary Lucier

results.title: Winter of our dreams
results.creator_credit: John Duigan, Richard Mason and Vega Film Productions
results.brief_description: An unstable relationship develops between prostitute Louise (Judy Davis), and a married man Rob (Bryan Brown), following the suicide of a mutual friend, Lisa. Lou (Davis), who is left with Lisa’s diaries becomes infatuated by her friend’s life and unrequited passion for Rob. She attempts to assume Lisa’s identity, in appearance, thoughts and actions, which poses the viewer with the question, will she too end her life? Lou sees in Rob an avenue for salvation from her life of drug addiction and prostitution. It is a destructive relationship, with Rob giving her little encouragement or hope. Rob is drawn to Lou for the possible insight she can offer into the years that passed between his sudden departure from Lisa and his now, unconventional marriage. Ultimately, it is a one sided relationship and Lou must decide whether she can make something of her life. Cast includes Bryan Brown, Judy Davis, Cathy Downes and Baz Luhrmann.

results.title: Two bagatelles
results.creator_credit: Grant Munro, Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Two short Norman McLaren films in which animation technique is employed with live actors. In the first, entitled On the Lawn, a male dancer waltzes to synthetic music. The second is a fast march, In the Backyard, accompanied by an old-fashioned calliope.

results.title: Two and Two
results.creator_credit: Anthony Bairstow, Babak Anvari, Kit Fraser and Flick Art
results.brief_description: In a school governed by a strict regime, the pupils are informed that what they had always been taught as fact is no longer true. But when the incredulous students speak out, they are forced to question how far they will go to stand up for their beliefs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anthony Bairstow, Babak Anvari, Kit Fraser and Flick Art
